pros: Fantastic place to work. People are lovely and very supportive.
cons: Slow moving. Unable to quickly react to situations. Challenging to make changes,

pros: Worked with some extremely talented and friendly people, all trying their hardest with integrity to publish and sell great titles to the best of their abilities.
cons:
Senior management: in certain cases they have been with CUP for over 10 years, with no prior experience of working for any other company, and are so stale and territorial.

Low pay: base salaries are low, and huge extra responsibility and additions to workloads are assigned with no financial recognition.

review_title: An environment where people are passionate about learning and research
pros: I am able to work autonomously and am trusted to carry out my work. Flexible and supportive working environment.  Smart, friendly, open and accountable management and colleagues. Opportunities for promotion and development.  Great work life balance.  You get to work on really interesting projects that make a difference.
cons: If you don't like working autonomously and need constant guidance and direction you won't like working at Cambridge.  If you don't like change you won't like working at Cambridge.

pros:
Nice location (if you live in Port Melbourne)
If you like dry textbooks full of pretentious academia this is the place for you!
cons:
No direction, no innovation and terrible benefits
Decisions based mostly on opinions of people out of touch with the world

review_title: Overall a great company to work for
pros: Great company, lots of really passionate people and good business practices.
